title: Fake News: More Protective MAGA Helmets NOT Available For Trump Supporters To Go Out In Public | Lead Stories
subtitle: Is President Donald Trump's official website now selling MAGA helmets to his supporters so they can protect themselves from being...
author: leadstories.com
vclaim:
Is President Donald Trump's official website now selling MAGA helmets to his supporters so they can protect themselves from being assaulted when going out in public? No, that's not true: the product is an invention of a satirical website with a Christian/conservative theme. It is not real.

The helmets appeared in an article published by The Babylon Bee on July 11, 2018 titled "More Protective MAGA Helmets Now Available For Trump Supporters Brave Enough To Go Out In Public" (archived here) which opened:

U.S.--While President Trump's official website has long sold Make America Great Again hats, a recent uptick in calls for public pushback against Trump supporters has led to the website replacing the hats with MAGA helmets for anyone brave enough to go out in public wearing them. "Want to go to the store in your MAGA hat, but afraid of being assaulted, having water thrown on you, or getting smacked with a baseball bat?" Trump says in a promo video on the website. "The MAGA helmet is for you. I've gotta say, I've seen lots of tactical helmets in my day. This one's the best. Tremendous stuff."

Users on social media only saw this title, description and thumbnail and so they might have believed the story was real:

More Protective MAGA Helmets Now Available For Trump Supporters Brave Enough To Go Out In Public U.S.--While President Trump's official website has long sold Make America Great Again hats, a recent uptick in calls for public pushback against Trump supporters has led to the website replacing the hats with MAGA helmets for anyone brave enough to go out in public wearing them. Just to make sure we checked the "hats" section of the webshop on President Trump's website and we found no trace of helmets being offered:

That, and "The Babylon Bee" comes with following dislaimer on every page:

With a track record like that it is clear that you shouldn't take anything posted on the site seriously and you definitely shouldn't confuse it with real news.
